I'm pleased to announce the release of `ggdag` 0.1.0 in CRAN! `ggdag` uses the powerful `dagitty` package to create and analyze structural causal models and plot them using `ggplot2` and `ggraph` in a tidy, consistent, and easy manner. You can use `dagitty` objects directly in `ggdag`, but `ggdag` also includes wrappers to make DAGs using a more R-like syntax:

```{r warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# install.packages("ggdag")
library(ggdag)

dag <- dagify(y ~ x + z,
       x ~ z) %>% 
  tidy_dagitty()

dag

ggdag(dag)
```

You can learn more about it on the [ggdag website](https://ggdag.netlify.com/), a `pkgdown` site that includes rendered documentation and the following vignettes:

- [An Introduction to ggdag](https://ggdag.netlify.com/articles/intro-to-ggdag.html)
- [An Introduction to Directed Acyclic Graphs](https://ggdag.netlify.com/articles/intro-to-dags.html)
- [Common Structures of Bias](https://ggdag.netlify.com/articles/bias-structures.html)

Give it a try, and please file an bugs or suggestions to the [GitHub repo](https://github.com/malcolmbarrett/ggdag). Thanks!
